content.title: Metasploit 2
content.details: The second workshop on Metasploit will build on the foundational knowledge gained in the previous session and delve deeper into advanced topics. The workshop will focus on the payload module which is used for creating the appropriate payload for a specific exploitation scenario, and for encoding and delivering the payload to the target system. The workshop will be a hands-on experience, with the participants getting the chance to practice their skills and apply what they have learned in a simulated environment. The goal of the workshop is to equip participants with the knowledge and skills needed to become proficient in using Metasploit for security testing.

content.title: Introduction To Metasploit
content.summary: The basics of using the metasploit framework including installation
details: This workshop looked into the core metasploit modules
And showing how to get access to them with msfconsole. It then runs through an example involving reconnaisance and enumeration

content.title: Introduction To Web Vulnerabilities
content.details: This hands-on workshop will provide you with a thorough understanding of one of the most common and dangerous web security threats: SQL injection. Weâ€™ll start by learning the basics of SQL and how it is used in web applications. From there, We'll explore the various techniques used to exploit SQL injection vulnerabilities including the use of sqlmap tool. Then, we will continue with a method called fuzzing which can be used to detect hidden pages, finding admin pages, navigate to documents and much more. There are many tools that can be used for fuzzing but for this workshop we will use WFuzz.

content.title: Introduction To Ethical Hacking
content.details: We will start by learning the basics of ethical hacking, including its definition, principles, and the crucial differences between ethical hacking and malicious hacking. Then, we will get straight to reconnaissance and information gathering that includes passive and active network reconnaissance. We will be focusing on Nmap which is one of the most useful tools in ethical hacking. Nmap is a versatile tool that is commonly used for active network reconnaissance. Everyone is advised to have a Kali Linux VM installed to follow along with the hands-on examples that we have prepared.

content.title: Introduction To Cybersecurity
content.details: Welcome to the first session of our comprehensive series of cybersecurity workshops! This initial session is designed to lay the foundation for your journey into the world of cybersecurity. This workshop is the first in a series of comprehensive cybersecurity workshops, designed to provide you with a comprehensive understanding of the field. Whether you are just starting your cybersecurity journey or looking to expand your knowledge, this initial session is the perfect opportunity to get a solid foundation in the basics of network security.
